listing.name: A Room With a View Close to Center

user.about:
Hello, 
I am happy to welcome you to the beautiful, historical Amstel Townhouse in the lovely De Pijp neighborhood of Amsterdam. The house, which was built in 1893, is overlooking the calming Amstel river and Lutmastraat street, one of Amsterdam's architectural attractions. The house also has a lovely gated garden. 
I hope you enjoy your stay and I will be there in person to assist you with making your stay as comfortable as possible. An assistant is there to help me keep up with communication as well so all your questions and booking inquiries can be answered as fast as possible. 

Welcome to wonderful Amsterdam!

Safe travels,

Wouter

listing.access: Guests are welcome to use the room, the bathroom, which features both a shower cabin and a bath tub, the small toilet room, as well as the kitchenette next to the room. The kitchenette features a microwave and hot water kettle and a fridge. To use the fridge, kindly write a few days prior to arrival for the host to turn it on. (There will be a one time 5 eur fee payable in cash for usage of the fridge for the duration of your whole stay.) There is no cooking facility in the kitchen except for the microwave.
listing.description:
Welcome to the Amstel Townhouse, built in 1893. This is the principal bedroom on the second floor of the house with large windows, stucco ceiling decorations and a small balcony overlooking one of the most pictoresque parts of the Amstel river banks.

This is one of those classic Amsterdam high ceiling rooms with beautiful stucco decorations, a fireplace and large windows. It is perfect for romantic candlelit evenings and experiencing Amsterdam as you always imagined it.

Guests are welcome to use the room, the bathroom, which features both a shower cabin and a bath tub, the small toilet room, as well as the kitchenette next to the room. The kitchenette features a microwave and hot water kettle and a fridge. To use the fridge, kindly write a few days prior to arrival for the host to turn it on. (There will be a one time 5 eur fee payable in cash for usage of the fridge for the duration of your whole stay.) There is no cooking facility in the kitchen except for the microwave.

In the future, this room will be rented to guests with only them being present on the floor, but for these two weeks you will be sharing the upstairs with the owner, whose bedroom is temporarily on the same floor. Wouter is very quiet and friendly and available to help you whenever he is at home.

from (URL HIDDEN)

"Apartments in De Pijp are a popular option for those who are looking to rent in a central location, while retaining a "neighbourhood" feel. De Pijp is a lively district which is located close to the centre of Amsterdam and also offers plenty of its own attractions. The area is renowned for its friendly bars, bustling pubs, and cosy live music venues. As one of Amsterdam's most culturally diverse areas, De Pijp also boasts an impressive range of dining options (including some legendary Moroccan restaurants), while its legendary Albert Cuyp market sells everything from clothing to bikes and fresh groceries. The residents are a lively mix of students, young working professionals and "old Amsterdammers" – all of whom offer a warm welcome to new faces!
Apartments for rent in beautiful traditional Dutch houses

Behind closed doors, the streets of De Pijp hide some of Amsterdam's most charming rental apartments. The architecture in this neighbourhood is based on traditional Dutch "golden age" design, with many houses dating back to the 1700s. This makes the streets themselves very attractive - but the buildings' interiors are equally impressive. Many apartments are surprisingly well-equipped, with deluxe interiors and fine furnishings to complement the quaint neighbourhood feel."

The tram station is located on Ceintuurbaan, a 6 minute walk away, down the Amstel river. Taxies are available locally, or we can help you book one. The Amstel train station is 6 minutes away by bike, 15 minute walk or a 6 minute taxi ride.

The bathroom and the toilet are separate for more comfort during your stay. there is an additional toilet downstairs.
listing.house_rules:
Kindly make yourselves at home and be happy. :)
Regarding smoking - you may smoke on the little balcony facing the Amstel, but not inside the house. 
Please note that the house features a traditional dutch staircase which takes a bit of getting used to.
listing.interaction: In the future, this room will be rented to guests with only them being present on the floor, but for these two weeks you will be sharing the upstairs with the owner, whose bedroom is temporarily on the same floor. Wouter is very quiet and friendly and available to help you whenever he is at home.

photos.caption: Good morning to this wonderful view.
Good morning to the 19th century stucco.
Good morning to the famous Dutch clouds.
Amsteldijk - in front of the house.
The little balcony. You may smoke there.
We have upgraded the room since this photo was taken - to a flat screen TV and a cozier bed placement as seen in next photo.
A mobile phone picture of the upgraded furniture placement and flat screen TV.
Soon we will update the pictures with new professional ones. This is for information purposes. NOtice the beautiful view of the river as you lie in your relaxing bed.
Gratis coffee and tea to welcome you.
Non slip floor glass cabin shower (with a chair for senior travellers)
The toilet is separate from the bathing facility.
Lutmastraat, a place of tourist interest for its unique architecture.

review.comments: Wouter was very friendly and helpful and made me feel welcome during my stay. The room was really nice with a  beautiful view of the Amstel river. It's in a great location - nice and quiet at night, and easy to get to the centre by getting the tram from near the house or by walking along the river.
